Apple___Apple_scab.prescription: Use resistant apple varieties; apply fungicide at bud break and repeat every 10–14 days during the growing season.
Apple___Apple_scab.application_instructions: Spray 20 grams in 10 liters of water before bud break and repeat application every 10–14 days.

Apple___Black_rot.prescription: Remove mummified fruits and infected twigs; apply fungicide pre-bloom and during growing season.
Apple___Black_rot.application_instructions: Spray 25 grams per 10 liters of water every 7–14 days during pre-bloom and early season.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prescription: Apply fungicide early in the spring; remove nearby cedar/juniper trees to reduce infection source.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.application_instructions: Spray every 10–14 days starting at bud swell until early summer.

Apple___healthy.prescription: No treatment required. Maintain orchard hygiene.
Apple___healthy.application_instructions: Monitor regularly for early signs of disease.

Blueberry___healthy.prescription: Maintain proper pruning and weed control.
Blueberry___healthy.application_instructions: Ensure adequate spacing and soil drainage.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.prescription: Apply sulfur-based fungicides and prune to improve airflow.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.application_instructions: Spray early morning every 7–10 days starting at bud break.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.prescription: No treatment necessary; maintain good orchard practices.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.prescription: Practice crop rotation; apply fungicide at tasseling stage.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.application_instructions: Apply fungicide at tasseling and repeat if conditions favor disease.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.prescription: Use resistant hybrids; apply fungicide if disease severity is high.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.application_instructions: Spray when rust pustules first appear and repeat every 7–14 days as needed.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.prescription: Plant resistant varieties and use foliar fungicides under disease pressure.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.application_instructions: Scout fields regularly; apply fungicide at early signs of disease.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.prescription: Maintain good field sanitation and crop rotation.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.application_instructions: Monitor for pest and disease incidence.

Grape___Black_rot.prescription: Remove infected leaves; apply fungicide pre-bloom and during growing season.
Grape___Black_rot.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days until berries reach pea size.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).prescription: No chemical control; remove and destroy infected vines.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).application_instructions: Avoid pruning during wet weather to reduce spread.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.prescription: Apply contact fungicides and improve canopy ventilation.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.application_instructions: Begin spraying when new leaves emerge; repeat every 7–14 days if needed.

Grape___healthy.prescription: Maintain balanced fertilization and regular pruning.
Grape___healthy.application_instructions: Monitor regularly for pest and disease.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).prescription: No cure available; promptly remove infected trees to prevent spread.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).application_instructions: Apply systemic insecticide as per label instructions; maintain psyllid control programs.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.prescription: Use copper-based sprays; plant resistant varieties.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.application_instructions: Spray during early growing season; avoid overhead irrigation.

Peach___healthy.prescription: Regular pruning and fertilization to maintain tree health.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.prescription: Use disease-free seeds; apply copper-based sprays to manage bacterial spot.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days; avoid working in wet fields to prevent spread.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.prescription: Continue monitoring and maintain balanced fertilization.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.application_instructions: Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilizers to reduce susceptibility.

Potato___Early_blight.prescription: Apply fungicides starting at flowering to prevent early blight.
Potato___Early_blight.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days until disease pressure subsides; remove and destroy crop debris.

Potato___Late_blight.prescription: Use certified seed and systemic fungicides to prevent late blight.
Potato___Late_blight.application_instructions: Apply fungicide preventively in wet conditions; avoid overhead irrigation.

Potato___healthy.prescription: Maintain well-drained soil and good crop hygiene.

Raspberry___healthy.prescription: Prune in early spring and monitor for pests.
Raspberry___healthy.application_instructions: Maintain good air circulation and remove diseased canes.

Soybean___healthy.prescription: Scout fields regularly for leaf spot and rust diseases.
Soybean___healthy.application_instructions: Practice crop rotation and field sanitation.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.prescription: Apply fungicides at first signs of powdery mildew.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days ensuring good airflow between plants.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.prescription: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides promptly.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.application_instructions: Avoid wetting foliage during irrigation; spray every 7–14 days if needed.

Strawberry___healthy.prescription: Ensure good drainage and adequate sunlight.
Strawberry___healthy.application_instructions: Maintain good field hygiene and monitor regularly.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prescription: Apply copper sprays and rotate crops to manage bacterial spot.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days during warm, wet conditions.

Tomato___Early_blight.prescription: Apply fungicide every 7–10 days; remove lower leaves to improve airflow.
Tomato___Early_blight.application_instructions: Start spraying at first sign of disease and continue through season.

Tomato___Late_blight.prescription: Use resistant varieties and apply systemic fungicides proactively.
Tomato___Late_blight.application_instructions: Spray preventively especially during wet weather; avoid overhead irrigation.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prescription: Improve ventilation and apply sulfur or copper-based sprays.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.application_instructions: Spray every 7–14 days; avoid wetting leaves while watering.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prescription: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides regularly.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.application_instructions: Rotate crops and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.prescription: Spray neem oil or insecticidal soap to control spider mites.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.application_instructions: Maintain high humidity and avoid water stress; spray every 7 days if infestation persists.

Tomato___Target_Spot.prescription: Apply fungicides during early fruit set to prevent target spot.
Tomato___Target_Spot.application_instructions: Spray every 7–10 days; remove and destroy infected leaves.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prescription: Use resistant varieties and control whitefly vectors.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.application_instructions: Apply insecticide every 10–14 days; remove infected plants immediately.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.prescription: Remove infected plants and sanitize tools to prevent spread.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.application_instructions: Control aphids; avoid smoking in the field.

Tomato___healthy.prescription: Maintain balanced fertilization and monitor plants weekly.
Tomato___healthy.application_instructions: Ensure adequate watering and nutrient supply.
